snippet: Officially, 9,200 people have died in the epidemic that began after the 2010 earthquake. But the real figure could be much worse, researchers found.
abstract: Doctors Without Borders study published in journal Emerging Infectious Diseases reports deaths from cholera epidemic that followed 2010 earthquake in Haiti could be much higher than 9,200 tallied due to underreporting.
lead_paragraph: Officially, 9,200 people have died in the epidemic that began after the 2010 earthquake. But the real figure could be much worse, researchers found.

headline.main: Cholera Deaths in Haiti Could Far Exceed Official Count
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Higher Toll by Cholera for Haitians
